alert.note: Alert for Fleming; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 7:59PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bath, southeastern Fleming and west central Rowan Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 759 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grange City, or 7 miles northeast of Owingsville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Moore`s Ferry and Sharkey around 810 PM EDT. Ramey around 815 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Salt Lick, Midland and Farmers. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 126 and 136. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
